intro: Rauvolfia viridis, commonly known as green roodfisch, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apocynaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers, which are followed by capsule fruits containing elliptical seeds. Rauvolfia viridis is often found in moist, shaded areas and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological and medicinal studies.
